results.title: The Developing child
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
How much do we know when we come into the world? Rousseau believed we came into the world with all the skills needed for survival, and were then warped by our contact with society. John Locke, however, saw young babies as a blank screen to be developed by life’s experience. This began the “nature versus nurture” debate in human psychology. Philip Zimbardo, in this program, investigates current evidence to decide whether heredity or environment is the major factor in a child’s development.

results.title: The Dreaming age = Meng huan shi jie
results.creator_credit: Lin Hongtong and Children's Film Studio (China)
results.brief_description:
Little Luo Fei, a middle-school student, is affected deeply by the changes brought about in her family by the arrival of Hua Guang, a famous musician and her mother’s erstwhile boyfriend.

Credits: Director, Lin Hongtong.
Cast: Wang Chunzi, Lou Jicheng

results.title: The Dream (Week 2)
results.creator_credit: Colin Bromley, Todd Abbott and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Games of the 27th Olympiad held in Sydney. Highlights from the television program ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. Features Roy and HG’s special comments on Greco-Roman wrestling, gymnastics, weightlifting, synchronized swimming, diving, taekwondo, boxing and equestrian dressage. Newsbreak with Bardot, Marcia Hines, Billie Jean King, Yvonne Kenny, Sam Riley as well as special guest appearances by Matt Welsh, Hayley Lewis, Gary Hall Jnr, Natalie Cook, Kerrie Pottharst, Todd Woodbridge, Mark Woodford and Tatiana Grigorieva.

results.title: The Dream (Week 1)
results.creator_credit: Colin Bromley, Todd Abbott and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Olympic Games. Highlights from the television progam ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the Sydney Olympic Games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. This tape shows highlights of week one including Eric Moussambini’s historic solo 100 metre swim, the Russian Gymnastics, diving, rowing and judo finals.

results.title: Earthquake in Turkey
results.material_description: digital screen recording of @matemusic1's TikTok post
results.brief_description: The dramatic collapse of a building in the aftermath of the recent earthquake that devestated Turkey and Syria - or is it? While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one turns out to be a building losing its scaffolding in Japan several years ago. Unlike traditional news media where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responds to disasters immediately but randomly. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings were able to post about their situation, alerting friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

The collapse of a building during the recent earthquake that devastated Turkey and Syria – or is it?

While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one is a building in Japan losing its scaffolding several years ago. Unlike traditional news media, where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responses to disasters may be immediate but they can also be inaccurate. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings in the earthquake used social media to alert friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.
description_for_label:
The collapse of a building during the recent earthquake that devastated Turkey and Syria – or is it?

While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one is a building in Japan losing its scaffolding several years ago. Unlike traditional news media, where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responses to disasters may be immediate but they can also be inaccurate. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings in the earthquake used social media to alert friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.

results.title: The Drag
results.creator_credit: Carlos Marchiori, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Animated cartoon about a young man who becomes a chain smoker. Explains to young people the psychology of the smoking habit, including the part played by cigarette advertising.

results.title: The Door without a key. The Landlady
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more fine tales introduced by the master of the macabre. “The Door without a key”: Uplifting tale of the comings and goings of a police-station late at night. Stars Claude Rains as a man with amnesia and Billy Mumy as a lost little boy. “The Landlady”: A young man arrives in a provincial town in England needing a place to stay. It was strange circumstance that drew the young man to stay at this boarding house, it was an even stranger circumstance that made him a permanent guest. A gentle horror story based on a Roald Dahl short story and adapted by Robert Bloch. Stars Dean Stockwell.
